column4: Allscripts expects bookings to rise in second quarter; shares up
column5: Healthcare IT company Allscripts Healthcare Solutions Inc  forecast its first quarterly growth in bookings in six quarters  sending up its shares by as much as 8.6 percent to a 15-month high.

column4: Novartis psoriasis drug superior to Enbrel in study
column5: ZURICH Novartis psoriasis drug secukinumab was superior to Amgen's Enbrel in a late-stage study  the Swiss company said on Monday  putting it in line to become the first of a clutch of new treatments to gain market approval.

column4: Apple colluded on e-book prices  judge finds
column5: NEW YORK In a sweeping rejection of Apple Inc's strategy for selling electronic books on the Internet  a federal judge ruled that the company conspired with five major publishers to raise e-book prices. |Â Video

column4: UPDATE 5-Apple colluded on e-book prices  judge finds
column5: NEW YORK  July 10 In a sweeping rejection of Apple Inc's strategy for selling electronic books on the Internet  a federal judge ruled that the company conspired with five major publishers to raise e-book prices.

column4: Caesars shares rise 13 percent on Internet gaming spin-off
column5: Shares of Caesars Entertainment rose 12.8 percent after the casino operator said in a regulatory filing that it will offer $1.2 billion in stock in a new company that will aggressively seek online gaming opportunities.

column4: Caesars shares rise 13 percent on Internet gaming spin-off
column5: July 10 Shares of Caesars Entertainment rose 12.8 percent after the casino operator said in a regulatory filing that it will offer $1.2 billion in stock in a new company that will aggressively seek online gaming opportunities.

column4: UK cost agency says 'no' to Celgene bone marrow drug
column5: LONDON Celgene's drug Revlimid is not worth using on Britain's state health service because of uncertainty over whether it can extend the lives of patients with serious bone marrow disorders  the country's cost agency said on Thursday.

column4: UK cost agency says "no" to Celgene bone marrow drug
column5: LONDON  July 11 Celgene's drug Revlimid is not worth using on Britain's state health service because of uncertainty over whether it can extend the lives of patients with serious bone marrow disorders  the country's cost agency said on Thursday.

column4: Universal lures 'Dark Knight' producer Tull from Warner Brothers
column5: LOS ANGELES NBCUniversal  cable giant Comcast's Hollywood unit  has signed Thomas Tull  luring the producer behind big budget blockbusters such as "The Dark Knight" and "Man of Steel" away from Warner Brothers and beating out other studios including Sony and 20th Century Fox.

column4: Wholesale inventories fall  likely drag on GDP growth
column5: WASHINGTON U.S. wholesale inventories fell in May by the most in a year and a half  the second straight monthly decline and a sign that restocking by businesses could weigh against economic growth in the second quarter.

column4: UPDATE 3-Tribune to separate broadcasting  publishing businesses
column5: July 10 Tribune Co will separate its publishing business from its more-profitable broadcast division  it said on Wednesday  following the path taken by Time Warner Inc and News Corp.

column4: LightSquared to proceed to trial over Ergen trades
column5: NEW YORK Bankrupt wireless communications firm Lightsquared Inc plans to go to trial with its lenders over whether Dish Network  chairman Charles Ergen's acquisition of big chunks of its loan debt violated an agreement pertaining to how LightSquared can restructure.

column4: Exclusive: Major Vivus shareholder to support activist's slate - source
column5: NEW YORK QVT Financial LP  the third-largest shareholder in obesity drugmaker Vivus Inc   intends to vote for the full slate of nine directors proposed by dissident investor First Manhattan Co  a source familiar with QVT's thinking said on Wednesday.

column4: EU to clear Baxter's $4 billion buy of Sweden's Gambro: sources
column5: BRUSSELS EU antitrust regulators will approve a $4 billion bid by Baxter International Inc for Sweden's Gambro AB after the U.S. company offered to sell a unit to ease competition concerns  two people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-EU to clear Baxter's $4 bln buy of Sweden's Gambro -sources

column4: Asiana passengers initially told not to evacuate after crash
column5: An Asiana pilot initially told flight attendants not to evacuate a Boeing 777 that had crashed onto a San Francisco airport runway  National Transportation Safety Board chairwoman Deborah Hersman said Wednesday.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Pilots in Asiana crash relied on automatic equipment for airspeed
column5: * Asiana Airlines chief executive arrives in San Francisco

column4: BP registers U.S. unit as swap dealer with regulator
column5: WASHINGTON Britain's BP Plc  on Wednesday filed to register its U.S. unit as a swap dealer with U.S. authorities  a company spokesman said  becoming the first oil company to face tough oversight of its derivatives business.

column4: Chevron 2nd-qtr oil  gas output falls on int'l maintenance
column5: July 10 Chevron Corp  the second-largest U.S. oil company  said on Wednesday its oil and gas production declined last quarter  mainly due to various shutdowns and maintenance work in Kazakhstan  Australia and Nigeria.

column4: Deutsche Bank complaint muddies Tchenguiz battle with UK fraud agency
column5: LONDON  July 10 Vincent and Robert Tchenguiz  who are suing Britain's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) over a botched investigation into the property tycoon brothers  were dealt a setback on Wednesday when Deutsche Bank objected to the disclosure of some SFO documents.

column4: STOCKS NEWS EUROPE-Deutsche Bank gains on Credit Suisse upgrade
column5: Deutsche Bank rises 1.7 percent  the third biggest riser on a falling German DAX 30  with traders citing an upgrade to the stock by Credit Suisse to "outperform" from "neutral" on valuation grounds.

column4: First Majestic  Endeavour Silver brace for more cost cutting as prices slump
column5: July 10 Canada's First Majestic Silver Corp   said it would cut 10 percent of its workforce by the end of this year as it struggles with weak silver prices  which have fallen to their lowest in nearly three years.

column4: Evercore taps UBS veterans for new private funds business
column5: NEW YORK  July 10 Evercore Partners Inc  said on Wednesday it would launch a secondary private funds unit to be headed by former leaders of UBS AG's business that also brokers sales of portfolios of private equity assets to investors.

column4: First Majestic  Endeavour Silver brace for more cost cutting as prices slump
column5: July 10 Canada's First Majestic Silver Corp   said it would cut 10 percent of its workforce by the end of this year as it struggles with weak silver prices  which have fallen to their lowest in nearly three years.

column4: Ford cuts price of 2014 electric Focus by 10 percent
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co.  will reduce the price of its 2014 Focus Electric compact car by 10 percent  the latest in a series of price cuts by major automakers on their battery-powered cars.

column4: UPDATE 4-Freeport Indonesia resumes underground mining  shipments
column5: * Mining contract renegotiations continue with government

column4: North American retailers set 5-year Bangladesh factory plan
column5: July 10 Nearly 20 North American retailers including Wal-Mart Stores Inc and Gap Inc  unveiled a 5-year safety plan for Bangladesh garment factories on Wednesday that would include inspecting every factory within a year.

column4: GM shifts production of Opel Mokka SUV from Korea to Spain
column5: BERLIN General Motors Co  is moving a large chunk of production of the new Mokka subcompact sport-utility vehicle from South Korea to Spain  responding to a rare bright spot of growing demand in depressed core European markets.

column4: GM shifts production of Opel Mokka SUV from Korea to Spain
column5: * Opel has 110 000 Mokka orders  mainly from Europe-spokesman

column4: Peugeot  GM study U.S. van program: report
column5: PARIS General Motors  may sell PSA Peugeot Citroen  commercial vans in the United States under plans being discussed to expand the carmakers' operational alliance  La Tribune reported on Wednesday.

column4: Peugeot  GM study U.S. van programme -report

column4: Nabors struggles in oversupplied fracking market
column5: A profit warning from Nabors Industries Ltd  highlights the struggles facing smaller companies as they get squeezed by bigger oil patch rivals such as Halliburton Co  in an oversupplied U.S. land drilling market.

column4: UPDATE 1-French HSBC tax case report reveals $5 bln in Swiss funds
column5: PARIS  July 10 France needs to beef up its methods of fighting tax evasion  according to a parliamentary report on a probe into HSBC that revealed $5 billion of undeclared assets in thousands of Swiss bank accounts.
